page.title: 08PLACE NAMES
page.content:
SYCAMORE:Streets with this name in Corstorphine were named after the Corstorphine Sycamore Tree. This beautiful tree still exists opposite Sycamore Terrace and is protected by a Tree Preservation Order. The tree was originally in the grounds of the former Corstorphine Castle and is believed to be three hundred years old. Under its branches, legend says, the granddaughter of the 1st Lord Forrester slew the 2nd Lord with his own sword.
LADIEMEADOW:The road takes its name from a field shown on maps of more than two hundred years ago. The name means meadow by the lade, a reference to the nearby Stank Burn.
CORSTORPHINE:This name is from the French{CROIX D'OR FIN:}fine gold cross
